ProgramElementMissionDescription.val:
Develops new and novel Anti-Tamper technologies for all Department of Navy weapon and combat systems.  The technologies to be developed will be new countermeasures to prevent reverse engineering of critical U.S. military systems.  The technologies include secure processing, sensors, architecture components, and enabling technologies.

This program is funded under SYSTEM DEVELOPMENT AND DEMONSTRATION because it includes those projects that have passed Milestone B approval and are conducting engineering and manufacturing development tasks aimed at meeting validated requirement prior to full-rate production decision.

SummaryExplanation.val:
The FY 2021 funding request was reduced by $0.883M to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

Project Unit 3414: Increase of $2.862M from FY 2020 to FY 2021 will fully fund technology development tasks, extensively evaluate technology prototypes and demonstrate units in labs.

ProjectMissionDescription.val: Anti-Tamper Program -  Perform as the Navy Technical Process Owner for the Anti-Tamper (AT) systems engineering activity that is intended to prevent and/or delay the exploitation of critical technologies in U.S. Systems. Manage the research, design, development, implementation, and testing of AT measures. Coordinate with Department of Defense AT Executive Agent and implement Department of Navy AT policy in conjunction with the Deputy Assistant Secretary Navy. Manage Security and Information Security requirements commensurate with the requirements of ALL Navy Programs throughout their lifecycles.

Text.val: Continue championing new technology with a focused and disciplined approach of development, assessment, evaluation, and transition to meet Navy program AT requirements. Maintain role in Anti-Tamper policy development for implementation and execution by the SYSCOMs incorporating Navy program AT requirements. Provide secure facilities, networks, computers, video/telephone conference and support personnel for collateral and Special Program operational environments to enable Anti-Tamper implementation and execution by SYSCOM's programs, incorporating AT requirements.

Continue championing new technology with a focused and disciplined approach of development, assessment,
evaluation, and transition to meet Navy program AT requirements. Maintain role in Anti-Tamper policy development for implementation and execution by the SYSCOMs incorporating Navy program AT requirements. Provide secure facilities, networks, computers, video/telephone conference and support personnel for collateral and Special Program operational environments to enable Anti-Tamper implementation and execution by SYSCOM's programs, incorporating AT requirements.

AppChangeSummary.val: Increase of $0.066 between FY 2020 and FY 2021 will be used to meet Anti-Tamper support demands.

AcquisitionStrategy.val: The program will fund project to provide secure facilities, networks, computers, video/telephone conference and support personnel for collateral and Special Program operational environments

ProjectMissionDescription.val: This project develops new and novel Anti-Tamper technologies for all Department of Navy weapon and combat systems.  The technologies to be developed will be new countermeasures to prevent reverse engineering of critical U.S. military systems.  The technologies include secure processing, sensors, architecture components, and enabling technologies. Low technology readiness level projects will be tested for  maturation and implemented to protect US technologies.  Government laboratory expertise will mature in Anti Tamper technologies and techniques.  Integration of various techniques  will enhance the strength of the protection scheme which limits the opportunities to exploit our technological advantage on the battlefield.

Description.val: This project develops new and novel Anti-Tamper technologies for all Department of Navy weapon and combat systems.  The technologies to be developed will be new countermeasures to prevent reverse engineering of critical U.S. military systems.  The technologies include secure processing, sensors, secure architecture components, and enabling technologies.

Text.val: Continue development of new and novel technologies that will become reverse engineering countermeasures for Department of the Navy weapon and combat systems. The project will include awarding technology development contracts and securing engineering support from DoN engineering facilities. Test and perform technical evaluations of low technical readiness level projects for implementation to protect US technologies.

Continue development of new and novel technologies that will become reverse engineering countermeasures for
Department of the Navy (DoN) weapon and combat systems. The project will include awarding technology development contracts and securing engineering support from DoN engineering facilities. Test and perform technical evaluations of low technical readiness level projects for implementation to protect US technologies. Extensively evaluate the technology prototypes and demonstration units in the labs, which will provide increased technical information and feedback to the technology developers.

AppChangeSummary.val: Increase of $2.862M from FY 2020 to FY 2021 will support the evaluation of developed prototypes and focus efforts on COTS protection, volume protection of microelectronics, extension of trust from secure to unsecure devices, cryptographic volume protection, and third party intellectual property solutions.

AcquisitionStrategy.val: This is a non-ACAT program.  The strategy will be to issue technology development contracts and use Department of Navy (DoN)labs for technology development, along with using DoN engineering organizations for engineering support.

Remarks.val: Increase from FY 2020 to FY 2021 will be used to extensively evaluate the technology prototypes and provide increased technical information and feedback to the technology developers.
Increase from FY 2020 to FY 2021 will be used to extensively evaluate the technology prototypes and provide increased technical information and feedback to the technology developers.
